intro: Lexarza, commonly known as the desert bellflower, is a flowering plant native to arid regions of the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the genus Pholistoma and is characterized by its small, bell-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink. The plant has succulent leaves and stems, which help it store water in its native dry environment. Lexarza typically grows in rocky soils and is often found in desert scrub and chaparral habitats. It is a perennial plant that blooms in late spring to early summer.
